intro: Satyrium hallackii subsp. hallackii, commonly known as the Hallack's satyrium, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and woodlands. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown spots. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
